metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2516 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Off-by-one error in the XML signature feature in Apache XML Security for C++ 1.6.0, as used in Shibboleth before 2.4.3 and possibly other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a signature using a large RSA key, which triggers a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2516` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-shib2 - 2.5.2+dfsg-2
libshibsp6 - 2.5.2+dfsg-2
shibboleth-sp2-schemas - 2.5.2+dfsg-2
No subscription required

libxml-security-c17 - 1.6.1-1
xml-security-c-utils - 1.6.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> shibboleth-sp2 apparently needs to be recompiled after the fix to xml-security-c

criterions.comment: shibboleth-sp2 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.2+dfsg-2').
xml-security-c package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.1-1').
